sentences.sContent: Mr. Oakley has always been ready to oblige journalists with information.
sentences.sCn: 奥克利先生一直乐于提供信息帮助记者们。

sentences.sContent: We called up three economists to ask how to eliminate the deficit and they obliged with very straightforward answers.
sentences.sCn: 我们致电3位经济学家咨询消除赤字的方法，他们满足了我们的要求，给出了非常直接的答复。

synos.tran: 迫使；强制；赐，施恩惠；责成

trans.tranOther: To oblige someone means to be helpful to them by doing what they have asked you to do

trans.tranOther: if you are obliged to do something, you have to do it because the situation, the law, a duty etc makes it necessary
